title: 3.7 cpu wheel compiled without numpy
body_html:
The 3.7 wheel for cpu/linux appears to have been compiled without numpy support.

$ python --version
Python 3.7.0 (default, Jul 15 2018, 05:19:52)
[GCC 8.1.0]
$ python -m venv test_env
$ source test_env/bin/activate
(test_env) $ pip install numpy
(test_env) $ pip install  http://download.pytorch.org/whl/cpu/torch-0.4.1-cp37-cp37m-linux_x86_64.whl
(test_env) $ python
>>> import numpy as np
>>> import torch
>>> torch.from_numpy(np.random.rand(1))
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "<stdin>", line 1, in <module>
RuntimeError: PyTorch was compiled without NumPy support
>>>
(test_env) $ wget https://raw.githubusercontent.com/pytorch/pytorch/master/torch/utils/collect_env.py
$ python collect_env.py
Collecting environment information...
PyTorch version: 0.4.1
Is debug build: No
CUDA used to build PyTorch: Could not collect

OS: CentOS release 6.9 (Final)
GCC version: (GCC) 8.1.0
CMake version: version 3.11.1

Python version: 3.7
Is CUDA available: No
CUDA runtime version: 8.0.61
GPU models and configuration:
GPU 0: GeForce GTX 1080 Ti
GPU 1: GeForce GTX 1080 Ti
GPU 2: GeForce GTX 1080 Ti
GPU 3: GeForce GTX 1080 Ti
Nvidia driver version: 384.111
cuDNN version: Could not collect
Versions of relevant libraries:
[pip3] numpy (1.15.0)[pip3] torch (0.4.1)
[conda] Could not collect

body:
The 3.7 wheel for cpu/linux appears to have been compiled without numpy support.

    $ python --version
    Python 3.7.0 (default, Jul 15 2018, 05:19:52)
    [GCC 8.1.0]
    $ python -m venv test_env
    $ source test_env/bin/activate
    (test_env) $ pip install numpy
    (test_env) $ pip install  http://download.pytorch.org/whl/cpu/torch-0.4.1-cp37-cp37m-linux_x86_64.whl
    (test_env) $ python
    >>> import numpy as np
    >>> import torch
    >>> torch.from_numpy(np.random.rand(1))
    Traceback (most recent call last):
      File "<stdin>", line 1, in <module>
    RuntimeError: PyTorch was compiled without NumPy support
    >>>
    (test_env) $ wget https://raw.githubusercontent.com/pytorch/pytorch/master/torch/utils/collect_env.py
    $ python collect_env.py
